chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David, when Nathan the prophet came unto him, after he had gone in to Bath-sheba.
items.plainText: To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David, when Nathan the prophet came unto him, after he had gone in to Bath-sheba.

items.text: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness: according unto the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions.
items.plainText: Have mercy upon me, O God, according to thy lovingkindness: according unto the multitude of thy tender mercies blot out my transgressions.

items.text: Wash me throughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.
items.plainText: Wash me throughly from mine iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin.

items.text: For I acknowledge my transgressions: and my sin is ever before me.
items.plainText: For I acknowledge my transgressions: and my sin is ever before me.

items.text: Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight: that thou mightest be justified when thou speakest, and be clear when thou judgest.
items.plainText: Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight: that thou mightest be justified when thou speakest, and be clear when thou judgest.

items.text: Behold, I was shapen in iniquity; and in sin did my mother conceive me.
items.plainText: Behold, I was shapen in iniquity; and in sin did my mother conceive me.

items.text: Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts: and in the hidden part thou shalt make me to know wisdom.
items.plainText: Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts: and in the hidden part thou shalt make me to know wisdom.

items.text: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.
items.plainText: Purge me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall be whiter than snow.

items.text: Make me to hear joy and gladness; that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.
items.plainText: Make me to hear joy and gladness; that the bones which thou hast broken may rejoice.

items.text: Hide thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.
items.plainText: Hide thy face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.

items.text: Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit within me.
items.plainText: Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit within me.

items.text: Cast me not away from thy presence; and take not thy holy spirit from me.
items.plainText: Cast me not away from thy presence; and take not thy holy spirit from me.

items.text: Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free spirit.
items.plainText: Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation; and uphold me with thy free spirit.

items.text: Then will I teach transgressors thy ways; and sinners shall be converted unto thee.
items.plainText: Then will I teach transgressors thy ways; and sinners shall be converted unto thee.

items.text: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation: and my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.
items.plainText: Deliver me from bloodguiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation: and my tongue shall sing aloud of thy righteousness.

items.text: O Lord, open thou my lips; and my mouth shall shew forth thy praise.
items.plainText: O Lord, open thou my lips; and my mouth shall shew forth thy praise.

items.text: For thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give it: thou delightest not in burnt offering.
items.plainText: For thou desirest not sacrifice; else would I give it: thou delightest not in burnt offering.

items.text: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.
items.plainText: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit: a broken and a contrite heart, O God, thou wilt not despise.

items.text: Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion: build thou the walls of Jerusalem.
items.plainText: Do good in thy good pleasure unto Zion: build thou the walls of Jerusalem.

items.text: Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt offering and whole burnt offering: then shall they offer bullocks upon thine altar.
items.plainText: Then shalt thou be pleased with the sacrifices of righteousness, with burnt offering and whole burnt offering: then shall they offer bullocks upon thine altar.
